alert.note: Alert for Beaver; Texas (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 22 at 8:03PM CDT until May 22 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Beaver County in the panhandle of Oklahoma... Southeastern Texas County in the panhandle of Oklahoma... Northwestern Ochiltree County in the panhandle of Texas... * Until 1100 PM CDT. * At 803 PM CDT, trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Bryan`s Corner. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 2 hours. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Perryton and Bryans Corner. Trained Spotter reported water flowing over roadways and was impassible as well as water in yards 6 miles southwest of Bryan`s Corner. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 2 HOURS
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
